176.article_body: Marta Kauffman, co-creator of American TV show 'Friends', has apologised for misgendering character Chandler Bing's transgender parent, Charles Bing, in the show. Kauffman told Fox News, "Pronouns weren't yet something that I understood. So...we didn't refer to that character as 'she'." "That was a mistake," Kauffman said, adding she regrets referring to Charles as Chandler's father.

177.title: Chilean hockey player proposes to boyfriend after scoring in women's WC, video viral
177.article_body: Chilean hockey player Francisca Tala proposed to her boyfriend after scoring a goal in her team's women's hockey World Cup 2022 match against Netherlands. "I made a bet with the girls that if I made a goal against the Netherlands, I had to marry my boyfriend," she said. Chile have reached the cross-over round in the ongoing World Cup.

178.title: Need over ₹2,000 cr monthly, ED trying to disrupt business: Vivo on frozen accounts
178.article_body: Referring to the Enforcement Directorate freezing its bank accounts, Vivo told the Delhi High Court that it has to make monthly payments of around ₹2,826 crore towards statutory dues, salaries, rent and daily business operations. It added that ED has undertaken a "roving and fishing enquiry” against it and continues to make "various attempts to disrupt" its business.

179.title: Russian bank reusing bank card chips to combat shortage amid Ukraine war
179.article_body: Russian bank SberBank has started reusing chips from un-activated bank cards to combat a shortage resulting from European suppliers halting deliveries amid the Ukraine war. "A shortage of chips for cards has started in Russia. We mostly worked with European chip producers...there is now a big problem with logistics from Europe," SberBank's head of cyber compliance Olga Maklashina said.

180.title: Jacqueline to play actress Priya Rajvansh in director Pradeep Sarkar's next
180.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez will play the role of actress Priya Rajvansh in her and filmmaker Chetan Anand's biopic. The film will be directed by Pradeep Sarkar and produced by Deepak Mukut. Notably, Priya Rajvansh worked exclusively for Chetan Anand and had starred in films including 'Haqeeqat', 'Heer Raanjha' and 'Hanste Zakhm'. She died on March 27, 2000.

181.title: Alia wishes Neetu Kapoor on her b'day, shares pic from her haldi ceremony
181.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to her Instagram Stories on Friday to share a post marking Neetu Kapoor's birthday. Sharing a picture from her haldi ceremony, Alia wrote, "Happiest birthday to the most beautiful soul...My mother-in-law/friend/soon-to-be dadi maaaaa...love you so so much!" Neetu turned 64 on Friday. Alia is expecting her first child with her husband, actor Ranbir Kapoor.

182.title: Who is Indian-origin Suella Braverman, who said she seeks to be UK's next PM?
182.article_body: Indian-origin UK MP Suella Braverman has publicly announced that she intends to seek the position of UK's Prime Minister after Boris Johnson's resignation. The 42-year-old is the UK's second female Attorney General who was appointed as the country's top legal official in February 2020. Braverman has studied Law at Queens' College, Cambridge and was called to the Bar in 2005.

183.title: Russia threatens to 'take back' Alaska from US
183.article_body: The Speaker of Russia's Lower House of Parliament, Vyacheslav Volodin, has threatened to "take back" Alaska from US if the country froze or seized Russian assets as punishment for its invasion of Ukraine. Russia colonised Alaska and established several settlements there until the US purchased it from Russia in 1867 for $7.2 million.

184.title: Actor Vikram admitted to hospital, team refutes reports of heart attack
184.article_body: Tamil actor Vikram was hospitalised on Friday and his publicist confirmed that the actor was taken to hospital after he complained of discomfort due to high fever symptoms. Contrary to some reports that claimed that Vikram suffered a heart attack and was therefore admitted to the hospital, his publicist said it was high fever and he's doing fine.

185.title: India lost a close friend today: Rajnath on ex-Japan PM Abe's assassination
185.article_body: Expressing grief over former Japan Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's assassination on Friday, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh tweeted, "India today has lost a close friend who assiduously worked towards strengthening bilateral relations." "I met with Mr Abe...in 2019. I found him to be an inspiring leader who had the vision to create a safe and better world," Singh added.

186.title: He could play for another 10 years: Finch on 35-yr-old David Warner
186.article_body: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch said 35-year-old Australian batter David Warner could play for another 10 years considering his fitness. "He loves the competition and [continues] to challenge himself," added Finch. "I can't believe people wrote Warner off...It was almost like poking the bear," Finch had said after Australia's triumph in the men's T20 World Cup 2021.

187.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav's health is improving: Daughter Misa Bharti
187.article_body: RJD leader Misa Bharti tweeted that the health of her father Lalu Prasad Yadav is improving. She also shared some photos of the RJD chief from hospital and wrote, "Lalu Ji's condition is much better...because of his morale and your prayers. Please don't pay attention to rumours." Lalu was hospitalised with severe injuries and airlifted to Delhi's AIIMS on Wednesday.

188.title: ED raids 18 places linked to J'khand CM Soren's close aide over tender scam
188.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday conducted raids at 18 locations in Jharkhand as part of a money-laundering investigation against MLA Pankaj Mishra, a close aide of Chief Minister Hemant Soren, officials said. The raids were conducted in connection with an alleged scam carried out while availing marketplace tender in Sahibganj's Barharwa in 2020.

189.title: Pics of late actor James Caan with Pacino from The Godfather's premiere go viral
189.article_body: Following the demise of James Caan, the late actor's pictures from the premiere of 'The Godfather' in 1972 have gone viral on social media. In the pictures, Caan can be seen interacting with Al Pacino and Ali MacGraw. The actor passed away aged 82. Mourning his demise, Pacino said, "Hard to believe that he won't be in the world anymore."

190.title: Hazlewood's IPL stint with CSK helped his T20 game: Aaron Finch
190.article_body: Australia limited-overs skipper Aaron Finch has said that pacer Josh Hazlewood's stint with Chennai Super Kings improved his T20 game. "For such a long time Hazlewood's focus was just on Test cricket...I think he got that in the lead-up to the last T20 World Cup while playing all 14 games for CSK," Finch said.

191.title: On-duty ITBP officer shoots himself dead in J&K's Poonch
191.article_body: An on-duty ITBP officer posted in J&K shot himself dead with his service weapon on Friday, officials said. The deceased personnel has been identified as Assistant Sub-Inspector Prem Chand, officials added. The incident took place at the Mini Secretariat in Poonch town, according to officials. They further informed that Chand was taken to the hospital where he was declared dead.

192.title: PCMC launches WhatsApp Chatbot to resolve public grievances in 6hrs
192.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has launched 'WhatsApp Chatbot' to address the public grievances related to civic services like waste collection and sewage accumulation. Additional Municipal Commissioner Vikas Dhakane said the administration will try to resolve the complaints in six hours. Reportedly, PCMC resolved more than 500 complaints via WhatsApp Chatbot in a single day.

193.title: 27-yr-old man held for opening fire at a person at gym in Delhi
193.article_body: A 27-year-old man has been arrested for opening fire at a person at a gym in Delhi's Patel Nagar area, police said. The incident took place after the victim had an argument with the man's girlfriend a few days ago, police added. The victim received a gunshot injury in the stomach and was rushed to a hospital, police further said.

194.title: Tesla sells record-high 78,906 China-made vehicles in June
194.article_body: Tesla sold record-high 78,906 China-made vehicles in June, including 968 for export, the China Passenger Car Association said. The automaker sold 32,165 vehicles and exported 22,340 in May. The overall passenger car sales in China in June totalled 1.97 million, up 22% from a year earlier. Out of the total sales, electric cars accounted for 27%.

195.title: North Korean hackers targeting US hospitals with Maui ransomware: US
195.article_body: The US government agencies, in an advisory, said that North Korean government-sponsored cyber hackers have used a ransomware, known as Maui, since May 2021 to target US health organisations. According to cybersecurity firm Chainalysis, these hackers made at least $731 million in 2021. The advisory noted that the ransomware disrupted the healthcare services "for prolonged periods".

196.title: Deeply saddened by demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe: Rahul
196.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday expressed condolences and said that he's "deeply saddened" by the demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe. "[Abe's] role in strengthening...strategic relationship between India and Japan was commendable," he added. He further said that Abe has left behind a "lasting legacy in...Indo-Pacific". Abe died after being shot while delivering a speech in Nara city.

197.title: Even in Australia, spin will play big part in T20 WC 2022: Finch
197.article_body: Australia white-ball captain Aaron Finch has said that spin bowling will play a big part, especially in the middle overs, during this year's ICC T20 World Cup in Australia. "Spin is always going to have an impact...especially on bigger grounds in Australia. Here you have got to hit it in a way to get it to the boundary," Finch said.

198.title: Edtech platform Gurusiksha raises ₹50 lakh in its 1st funding round
198.article_body: Online tutoring and mentoring platform Gurusiksha has secured ₹50 lakh from angel investors in its first funding round. The startup plans to raise another funding round later this year. The newly-raised funds will be deployed for purposes like business expansion and adding more courses, the company said. Founded in 2016 by Dipak Jha, Gurusiksha claims to operate across India.

199.title: Bullet train project chief Satish Agnihotri fired over charges of corruption
199.article_body: The Railways has terminated the services of NHSRCL MD Satish Agnihotri, who was in charge of the government's bullet train project, following a Lokpal court order directing the CBI to probe corruption allegations against him. According to officials, there were several allegations against Agnihotri, including misuse of his official position and diverting funds illegally to a private company.

200.title: Delhi govt guarantees startup incubation for Business Blasters winners
200.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Friday tweeted that the Delhi government will be guaranteeing admission to colleges and incubation for startups to students who got successful in the Business Blasters initiative. Under the initiative, a total of 51,000 business ideas were proposed by around three lakh students from Classes 11 and 12, out of which 126 got investor funding.

201.title: NASA shares pic from world's biggest telescope, says 'Unexpected view of the universe'
201.article_body: NASA has shared a picture captured by the Fine Guidance Sensor (FGS) of the world's biggest telescope, James Webb Space Telescope. "Talk about an overachiever! Gaze at this test image...an unexpected & deep view of the universe," NASA wrote alongside the picture. NASA is expected to release the first full-colour images from the telescope next week.

202.title: Bullet that killed former Japan PM Shinzo Abe 'reached his heart': Doctors
202.article_body: The bullet that killed former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe "reached his heart", doctors at Nara Medical University, who were treating him said in a news conference on Friday. Abe was bleeding profusely and doctors couldn't stop the bleeding, medical officials said. He was pronounced dead at 5:03 pm local time, officials added.

203.title: Water supply disrupted in Delhi due to high ammonia levels in Yamuna
203.article_body: Water supply was disrupted in parts of Delhi on Friday, due to a rise in ammonia levels in the Yamuna river, according to the Delhi Jal Board (DJB). Operations at the Wazirabad, Chandrawal and Okhla water treatment plants have been affected. Water supply will remain affected till the situation improves, the DJB had earlier said.

204.title: I shouldn't have been so greedy as an actor: Amar on quitting 'Kyunki...'
204.article_body: Amar Upadhyay said he quit TV show 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' as he had signed three movies. "When I left Kyunki, it was a hard decision," he added. Further, while regretting his decision, Amar said that he shouldn't have been so greedy as an actor. "Today, I would've stuck to Kyunki and told them to wait," Amar added.

205.title: Hardik surprised England's best batters, bossed 1st T20I totally: Jaffer
205.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said Hardik Pandya, who became the first Indian to score a half-century and record a four-wicket haul in a T20I, during the first T20I against England "totally bossed" the match. "He hit that deck hard...bowled that channel which is hard to hit and surprised [England's best batters]," added Jaffer. Hardik smashed 51 runs off 33 balls.

206.title: 80-yr-old woman found dead with her throat slit in Delhi; probe on
206.article_body: An 80-year-old woman was found dead inside her house in Delhi's Shalimar Bagh area on Friday. DCP (Northwest district) Usha Rangnani said the woman was found lying on the bed with her throat partially slit. Rangnani said her ornaments and household articles were found intact, adding that prima facie, it appears the assailant had a friendly entry into the house.

207.title: Fatherhood is certainly life-changing: Nick Jonas on Malti Marie
207.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra's husband singer Nick Jonas recently spoke about his daughter Malti Marie, saying that she is amazing and brings him a lot of joy. He further said, "[Fatherhood] is certainly life-changing." Priyanka and Nick welcomed their daughter via surrogacy in January 2022. Malti Marie was born premature and had to spend over 100 days in the NICU.

208.title: Sanctions over Ukraine a declaration of economic war by West: Russia
208.article_body: The West's attempts to isolate Russia with sanctions are akin to a declaration of economic war, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Friday. Russia will now turn to China and India and other nations outside the West, he added. Notably, Ukraine and the West have termed Russia's invasion an imperial-style land grab.

209.title: I'll give equal importance to my batting, bowling: Hardik after 1st T20I win
209.article_body: Following his 4/33 and 51 in India's 50-run win against England in first T20I, India all-rounder Hardik Pandya said he'd give equal importance to his batting and bowling. "Bowling bit will take more credit because that spell brought us in the game...made it difficult for England to stay in the game," he added. Hardik was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

210.title: Delhi court frames charges of rioting, attempt to murder against 3 in riots case
210.article_body: A Delhi court has framed charges of rioting, attempt to murder, unlawful assembly and dacoity against three persons in the 2020 Northeast Delhi riots case. The accused had allegedly attacked a Muslim man with a sword during the riots near Khajuri Khas. No case was made out for offence under IPC section 436 (arson), the court said.

211.title: If anybody can swing the ball in Aus, it'll be Bhuvneshwar: Giles on T20 WC
211.article_body: Talking about Bhuvneshwar Kumar who conceded 10 runs and dismissed Jos Buttler in the first T20I against England, ex-England spinner Ashley Giles said, "If anybody swings [the ball in Australia during T20 World Cup 2022] it'll be Bhuvi." "He has inked his name into [India's] World Cup squad already," added Giles. Bhuvneshwar had an economy rate of 3.33.

212.title: CM Eknath Shinde meets Maha Metro MD, reviews Pune Metro project
212.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Thursday reviewed the Pune Metro project work during a meeting with Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited's (Maha Metro) Managing Director Brijesh Dixit. CM Shinde was also informed about the current status of the 48.2-km phase two project report of Pune Metro. "The CM has assured...that Pune Metro project would get all possible assistance," Dixit said.

213.title: Cases of typhoid in Hyderabad on increase following monsoon
213.article_body: As monsoon has struck Hyderabad, the cases of typhoid are reportedly on a rise. Hospitals in the city have reported around 10-20 cases per week in the past two weeks. Most of these cases have been reported from Amberpet, Hafeezpet, Banjara Hills, Tolichowki and Mehdipatnam areas. "There's no outbreak of typhoid yet since cases are limited," a doctor said.

214.title: 2 killed, 48 injured as bus falls into 150-foot-deep gorge in J&K
214.article_body: Two persons were killed and 48 others were injured when a bus carrying a wedding procession fell into a 150-foot-deep gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district. "The bus hit a tree while rolling down the gorge, which reduced the impact and, perhaps, saved several lives," a police officer said. The injured persons are undergoing treatment at hospitals.

215.title: PM Modi shares pic from his most recent meeting with Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe
215.article_body: Following the demise of Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe after he was shot at, PM Narendra Modi shared a picture with him from their most recent meeting in Tokyo. "Always passionate about strengthening India-Japan ties, he had just taken over as...Chairman of...Japan-India Association," wrote PM Modi. One day national mourning has been announced on July 9 as a mark of respect.

216.title: Teachers' body criticises NCERT for removing chapters on climate change
216.article_body: Teachers Against the Climate Crisis (TACC) has criticised NCERT for removing certain chapters on climate change from the school syllabi. The removed portion includes chapters on the greenhouse effect, weather, climate, water, weather systems and Indian monsoon among others from syllabi of different classes. "We...are deeply dismayed by the many recent changes to school syllabi," TACC said.

217.title: Cong has misused Gandhi's name; brought country to a sorry state: CM Bommai
217.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has accused Congress of misusing Mahatma Gandhi's name and bringing the country to a sorry state. "Congress is in the position of a convict. They bowed to lobbies...They do not have the moral right to preach to others," CM Bommai said. "There are more such scams which Congress has buried. They would be exposed," he added.

218.title: Shinzo Abe shooting is 5th gun attack on Japan politician since 1990: Report
218.article_body: Shooting of Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe is the fifth involving a politician of Japan since 1990, said NHK. In 1990, Motoshima Hitoshi, then-mayor of Nagasaki, was injured in an attack. In 1992 and 1994, attacks took place on then-LDP Vice President Kanemaru Shin and ex-PM Hosokawa Morihiro respectively, but both were unharmed. Nagasaki Mayor Ito Itcho was killed in 2007.

219.title: Indian startups' funding fell 33% to $6.9 bn in June quarter: Report
219.article_body: The total funding raised by Indian startups in the June quarter fell 33% to $6.9 billion in 409 funding rounds, Tracxn reported. The startups had raised $10.1 billion in the same quarter last year. The report added that 121 new startups closed their first funding rounds, four startups turned unicorns and 62 got acquired in the quarter.

220.title: PM Modi announces one day national mourning on July 9 as a mark of respect for Abe
220.article_body: After the demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "As a mark of our deepest respect for former Prime Minister Abe Shinzo, a one day national mourning shall be observed on 9 July 2022." "I am shocked and saddened beyond words at the tragic demise of one of my dearest friends, Shinzo Abe," he wrote.

221.title: Was unceremoniously dropped from 'Bombay...', my star value wasn't high: Ranveer
221.article_body: Ranveer Singh, during his appearance on 'Koffee with Karan season 7', said that he was "unceremoniously dropped" from 'Bombay Velvet'. "I was unceremoniously dropped because at the time I couldn't justify the budget. My star value wasn't high...But things have changed," he said. The lead role was eventually played by Ranbir Kapoor in the film, which was released in 2015.

222.title: Just wanted to share our joy: Ranbir on pregnancy being called 'promo stunt'
222.article_body: Speaking about his pregnancy announcement with his wife Alia Bhatt being called a "promotional stunt" for their upcoming film 'Brahmāstra', actor Ranbir Kapoor said that they just wanted to share their joy. "Alia and I as a married couple...felt it was the right time. We just wanted to share...the news and there was no other thought to it," he added.

223.title: Physiotherapist arrested for molesting female patient in Greater Noida clinic
223.article_body: A physiotherapist has been arrested for allegedly molesting a 20-year-old woman on the pretext of examining her at the former's clinic in Greater Noida, officials said. Officials added that the woman had gone to the clinic for consultation when the alleged incident took place. According to police, the woman had to run away from the clinic.

224.title: K'taka reports 1,053 new COVID-19 cases, 966 reported in B'luru
224.article_body: Karnataka on Thursday reported 1,053 new coronavirus cases, of which 966 cases were from Bengaluru alone, according to official data. However, the number of new cases recorded in both the state and the city was slightly less than the day before. The city's positivity rate was 4.96% and the number of active clusters was 22, the data revealed.

225.title: Batters were fearless, bowlers very clinical: Laxman on India's 1st T20I win
225.article_body: Praising India after their 50-run win against England in first T20I, VVS Laxman, who coached India, said the batters were fearless and bowlers very clinical. "Fabulous win last night! Proud of the way the boys approached the match right from the start and came out on top of it," he tweeted. India lead the three-match series 1-0.

226.title: Payal, Sangram perform puja at temple in Agra ahead of wedding
226.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi and wrestler Sangram Singh recently performed puja at a temple in Agra. The couple, who is set to tie the knot on July 9, visited Prachin Rajeshwar Mahadev Mandir to seek blessings. Payal's mehendi ceremony was held on July 6, pictures of which were shared by the actress on her Instagram handle.

227.title: Heavy rain increases water levels in 4 Pune dams by 1 TMC in 24hrs
227.article_body: Following heavy rainfall, the water levels in four dams supplying water to Pune have increased by nearly one thousand million cubic feet (TMC) in the last 24 hours. The water storage in four dams Khadakwasla, Panshet, Varasgaon and Temghar has now reached 5.45 TMC. Last week, due to deficit rainfall, the storage in these dams had dropped to 2.5 TMC.

228.title: Rishi Sunak's wife brings tea to reporters waiting outside their home, pic surfaces
228.article_body: Rishi Sunak's wife Akshata Murty was seen serving tea and biscuits to journalists waiting outside their family home in London following Sunak's resignation as UK's Finance Minister. Murty is the daughter of Infosys' billionaire Founder NR Narayana Murthy. Notably, after the resignation of Boris Johnson, Sunak is said to be among the leaders in race to become the next PM.

229.title: BJP shouldn't teach Bengalis how to worship Goddess Kali: Moitra
229.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra reacted to BJP criticising her remarks on Goddess Kali, saying that they "shouldn't teach Bengalis how to worship" the goddess. BJP should stop imposing its "version of Hinduism...based on established norms of North India" on other parts of India, she added. Earlier, Moitra said that to her, "Goddess Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess."

230.title: 6 dead, 10 injured as bus crashes into truck in Tamil Nadu; PM expresses grief
230.article_body: Six persons died and over 10 others sustained injuries on Friday morning after the driver of the government bus in which they were travelling rammed into a stationary truck in Tamil Nadu's Chengalpattu district. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while expressing grief over the loss of lives, said, "My thoughts are with those who have lost their loved ones."

231.title: 5 held in Brazil in $3 bn money laundering case involving crypto
231.article_body: Brazil's federal police carried out 'Operation Greed' on Thursday and arrested five people of a group believed to have laundered money made from illegal gold mining, Reuters reported. The group created its own crypto token and used other methods as well to launder funds, the police said. Over $3 billion moved through the group's bank accounts between 2019-21, it added.

232.title: Former Japan PM Shinzo Abe dies after being shot at during speech
232.article_body: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has died after being shot while delivering a speech in the city of Nara. Police said that the attacker, identified as 41-year-old Yamagami Tetsuya, told investigators that he was "dissatisfied" with Abe and "intended to kill him". The video of the attacker, who shot Abe from behind, had surfaced on social media.

233.title: Vivo India moves Delhi HC challenging freezing of bank accounts by ED
233.article_body: Vivo India on Friday approached the Delhi High Court challenging the freezing of its bank accounts by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a money laundering case. "We have 9,000 employees. There is a liability," said advocate Siddharth Luthra. The ED seized 119 bank accounts of various entities with ₹465 crore including Vivo India's fixed deposits of around ₹66 crore.

234.title: Theranos' Pak-born executive Ramesh Balwani found guilty of fraud in US
234.article_body: Ramesh 'Sunny' Balwani, the former President of Theranos and ex-boyfriend of its Founder Elizabeth Holmes, has been found guilty of fraud in US. The Pakistan-born executive was convicted on two counts of conspiracy and 10 counts of fraud. Balwani and Holmes were accused of exaggerating the abilities of Theranos' machines. The startup was valued at $9 billion before its collapse.

235.title: Fintech startup Innoviti raises $45 million in Series D round
235.article_body: Fintech startup Innoviti Payment Solutions has raised $45 million in Series D funding round led by Singapore-based Panthera Growth Partners, which invested $15 million. Investments were also made by existing investors FMO and Bessemer Venture Partners as well as new investors like Alumni Ventures. The Bengaluru-based startup also raised debt from Trifecta Capital as part of the round.

236.title: We are world's 3rd largest startup ecosystem today: PM Modi
236.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while addressing the Akhil Bhartiya Shiksha Samagam in Varanasi, stated that India is now the third-largest startup ecosystem in the world. "Not only did we recover so fast from the big epidemic of coronavirus, but today India is one of the fastest-growing large economies of the world," he added.

237.title: Rashmika to star opposite Tiger Shroff in his untitled next: Report
237.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna will reportedly star opposite Tiger Shroff in his untitled next. "The team will be shooting in India as well as internationally," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. The film will be directed by Shashank Khaitan and produced by Karan Johar. It is expected to go on floors in the month of September, reports added.

238.title: BJP bags 102 of 130 panchayat seats unopposed in Arunachal Pradesh
238.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has won 102 out of 130 seats unopposed in the gram panchayat elections in Arunachal Pradesh. Other 14 seats were bagged by Congress, National People's Party (NPP) and independent candidates. Chief Minister Pema Khandu thanked all BJP supporters on Twitter and said, "Congratulations and thanks to all karyakartas, supporters and sympathisers."

239.title: In a first, Gujarat to host 36th National Games in Sept: CM Patel
239.article_body: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel announced that they will be hosting the National Games for the first time this year. The western state will host the 36th edition between September 27 and October 10, CM Patel said. "Gujarat has been equipped with world-class sports infrastructure...[we] will leave no stone unturned to make the National Games best till date," he tweeted.

240.title: New players expressing themselves well; bench strength getting better: Pandya
240.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya has said that the new players who are coming into the Indian team are "expressing themselves really well". "The bench strength is getting better. The culture is changing," Pandya said. "They (management) have given us the freedom...Even if we get out playing a stroke, we never get a vibe after coming back," Pandya added.

241.title: CoinSwitch appoints ex-Flipkart exec as crypto Head of Engineering
241.article_body: CoinSwitch has appointed former Flipkart executive Sudheer Tumuluru as the crypto Head of Engineering. The news comes a day after CoinSwitch said three of its top executives and a senior blockchain engineer had left the company to start their own Web3 venture. Tumuluru, who served as a Director of Engineering at Flipkart, was also VP of Engineering at Myntra.

242.title: Former PayPal executive Jasmine Lee appointed Binance.US CFO
242.article_body: Binance.US, the US partner of world's largest crypto exchange Binance, appointed ex-PayPal Holdings executive Jasmine Lee as Chief Financial Officer (CFO) on Thursday. Lee has replaced interim CFO Eric Segal, who recently left the company after holding the role since October 2021. Jasmine had previously served as CFO and Chief Operating Officer for the Consumer Product Group at PayPal.

243.title: Deepak Hooda's performance will put pressure on Kohli: Wasim Jaffer
243.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said India batter Deepak Hooda's performance in the first T20I against England will "put pressure" on Virat Kohli when he returns to the team for the second T20I. Hooda scored 33 runs off 17 balls in the first T20I. Hooda recently became the fourth Indian to smash a ton in the history of men's T20Is.

244.title: Pakistani cricketer Kamran Akmal's sacrificial goat gets stolen from his Lahore residence
244.article_body: One of the sacrificial goats Pakistani cricketer Kamran Akmal had bought for Eid ul Adha was stolen from outside his house in Lahore. Akmal’s father said that they had bought six goats to sacrifice a day ago and tied them outside their home. The theft reportedly took place at around 3 am.

245.title: Twitter fires 30% staff from its talent acquisition team amid deal with Musk
245.article_body: Months after announcing a hiring freeze, Twitter on Friday fired 30% of its talent acquisition team amid its $44 billion acquisition deal with Tesla CEO Elon Musk. A Twitter spokesperson confirmed these layoffs but did not share the exact number of affected employees. While these employees will receive severance packages, the company will "reprioritise" the remaining recruitment staff.

246.title: Karan Kundrra buys Jeep Wrangler Rubicon worth ₹60.35 lakh
246.article_body: Actor Karan Kundrra has bought a Jeep Wrangler Rubicon which is worth around ₹60.35 lakh. The actor recently shared the news with his fans and followers on his official YouTube channel. According to reports, Karan has one Range Rover Sport SVR, a Mini Cooper and an older generation of Ford Endeavour and a Ducati Diavel bike.

247.title: It didn't have the same control we saw for GT: Swann on Hardik's 51(33)
247.article_body: Ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann said Hardik Pandya's 51 off 33 balls in the first T20I against England didn't have the same control as visible in his knocks for GT during IPL 2022. Swann added this was because Hardik was taking his time while batting for GT. Hardik's 51 comprised six fours, a six. He had a strike rate of 154.54.

248.title: 1 student dies, 13 injured as tree uproots and falls on them at Chandigarh school
248.article_body: At least one student died and 13 got injured after a tree got uprooted and fell on them at Carmel Convent School in Chandigarh's Sector 9. Those injured were shifted to a hospital, ANI reported. Reportedly, the condition of a student and teacher is critical. The tree that fell was around 70 feet tall and 250 years old, reports added.

249.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts today and tomorrow
249.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power outages today and tomorrow as BESCOM is carrying out maintenance and repair works. Most of these works will be done between 10 am and 5 pm. The areas that will be affected today include Navilu Nagar, Vinayaka Nagar etc. While the areas that will face power cuts tomorrow include Indira Nagar, KR Road etc.

250.title: India responds after China's statement on PM Modi's birthday greetings to Dalai Lama
250.article_body: India has responded after China's statement on PM Narendra Modi's birthday greetings to Dalai Lama. "It is a consistent policy of the government of India to treat His Holiness Dalai Lama as an honoured guest in India," government said. "His Holiness is accorded all due courtesies and freedom to conduct his religious and spiritual activities in India," the government added.

251.title: Wanted to make a movie like Jumanji, Indiana Jones: Sudeepa on Vikrant Rona
251.article_body: Kichcha Sudeepa, while speaking about his upcoming movie 'Vikrant Rona', said, "I insisted...we shoot everything indoor. We get the aesthetics right. No real locations." "I started thinking and feeling like we need to make a film like 'Jumanji'. We should have sets like 'Tarzan', 'Indiana Jones'. And nothing real-time can support you on that. You have to create," he added.

252.title: Crypto firm Celsius accused of fraud weeks after it froze users' assets
252.article_body: Celsius Network, which froze assets last month, used customer funds to rig the price of its crypto token and failed to hedge risk, a former money manager for the company has said. Celsius allegedly ran a Ponzi scheme to benefit itself through "gross mismanagement of customer deposits". The platform paused all transfers and withdrawals in June citing ''extreme market conditions''.

253.title: Heavy rainfall causes rock sliding in Pune; road cleared in 30 mins
253.article_body: A rock sliding incident took place near old Katraj tunnel in Pune as the city witnessed heavy rainfall. The road was cleared within 30 minutes with the help of a JCB machine, officials said. "There was a fear of the rock hitting vehicles...however, there were no casualties. Such an incident has occurred after two-three years," Dhankawadi Assistant Municipal Commissioner said.

254.title: No coercive action against TV anchor Ranjan: SC in Rahul Gandhi video case
254.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday ordered "no coercive action of arrest" against TV anchor Rohit Ranjan in connection to multiple FIRs being filed against him after a misleading clip about Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was aired on his show. Ranjan approached the top court seeking an urgent hearing on his plea for protection from coercive action for the alleged offence.

255.title: 3 friends jump into canal to prove friendship in Faridabad; 1 rescued
255.article_body: Three drunk friends reportedly jumped into the Agra canal in Faridabad to prove their commitment to each other, police said on Thursday. While one of them has been rescued, other two are still missing. "All three of us jumped into canal one by one to prove how far we could go to prove our friendship," the rescued person told police.

256.title: Ons Jabeur becomes 1st Arab player, African woman to enter Grand Slam final
256.article_body: Women's tennis player Ons Jabeur has become the first Arab and Tunisian as well as the first African woman to enter a Grand Slam final after reaching the final of Wimbledon 2022. Jabeur defeated Tatjana Maria 6-2, 3-6, 6-1 in the semi-final. "I want to...inspire many more generations...We never believed...that we can do it, but...I'm trying to show...them," she said.

257.title: Bodies of 3 youths, aged 14-20, recovered from Yamuna in Delhi
257.article_body: Bodies of three youths, aged between 14 and 20 years, were retrieved from the Yamuna river in Burari, Delhi. The youths had come from Loni to take a bath before they drowned in the river, police said. The search operation is still underway as the body of the fourth youth is yet to be recovered, police added.

258.title: 18 held in Karnataka's Kerur after 3 stabbed during clashes, shops burnt
258.article_body: Karnataka's Bagalkote Police arrested 18 persons and registered four FIRs after three persons were stabbed in Kerur and shops were burnt. Clashes broke out between two groups after members of each side accused the other of harassing women. A Hindutva group leader accused Muslim men of eve-teasing a Hindu girl, police said. Large gatherings are banned till Friday in Kerur.

259.title: Johnny Depp donates earnings from NFT sale to charity associated with Amber Heard
259.article_body: Johnny Depp has donated the proceeds from an NFT sale to four charities, including the Children's Hospital Los Angeles, which has ties to Amber Heard. Depp's Never Fear Truth NFT (non-fungible token) platform announced that it had raised nearly $800,000. After the announcement, fans praised The Pirates of the Caribbean actor for his "never-ending kindness".

260.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹1 lakh while trying to claim birthday gift
260.article_body: An air hostess from Mumbai was cheated of ₹1 lakh while trying to claim her birthday gift from an online shopping company. According to police, the complainant had received a link by the courier service to claim her parcel. She then shared her bank details on the link following which ₹1 lakh was transferred from her account, police added.

261.title: SC grants interim bail to Alt News' Zubair in case against him in UP's Sitapur
261.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday granted interim bail to Alt News Co-founder Mohammad Zubair in the case registered against him in Sitapur, Uttar Pradesh. The court also issued notice to the UP police on Zubair's plea challenging Allahabad High Court order. The Allahabad High Court had dismissed petition moved by Zubair challenging FIR registered against him for a tweet.

262.title: In bid to implicate his grandfather, man kills 6-yr-old child in UP
262.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly murdered a six-year-old child in a bid to implicate his own grandfather who had stopped the accused from playing PUBG. During interrogation, the accused reportedly confessed that he kidnapped the child, sealed his lips with adhesive and strangled him to death. The deceased used to take tuition from the accused's grandfather.

263.title: Over 50% road accidents in last 6 months involved bikers: Cyberabad police
263.article_body: Nearly 58% of road accidents recorded over the last six months in Cyberabad involved those riding two-wheelers, Cyberabad Traffic Police said. Out of the 363 deaths reported since January 1 this year, 211 fatalities included those driving two-wheelers or riding pillion, the police added. Officials further noted that around 191 victims were riding the vehicle without a helmet.

264.title: Deeply shocked by attack on my friend Shinzo Abe: Manmohan Singh
264.article_body: Former PM Manmohan Singh on Friday reacted to former Japan PM Shinzo Abe being shot at during a speech in Nara city, saying, "Deeply shocked by the tragic attack on my friend [former Japan PM Abe]." "My prayers are with him and [his] family," Singh added. A 41-year-old man who reportedly shot Abe from behind has been arrested.

265.title: Outgoing US Secret Service Director to be Snap's security head
265.article_body: Snapchat-parent Snap has said that the outgoing US Secret Service Director James Murray will join the social media platform as its Chief Security Officer following his retirement from the service. Murray will start in his new role with Snap on August 1. He will be reporting directly to Chief Executive Officer Evan Spiegel.

266.title: Samantha in talks for Vicky's 'The Immortal Ashwatthama': Report
266.article_body: The makers of Vicky Kaushal starrer 'The Immortal Ashwatthama' have reportedly approached Samantha Ruth Prabhu for a role in the upcoming film. "Samantha has liked the world of Aditya (Dhar, director), however, the talks are still in a very advanced stage," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. The film will go on the floors in 2023, the report said.

267.title: Dismissed Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla gets bail in corruption case
267.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has granted bail to AAP leader and dismissed Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla. He was arrested on May 24 by the state's Anti-Corruption Branch following corruption allegations against him and was removed from the state Cabinet. Singla was allegedly demanding a 1% commission from officials for contracts, Punjab Chief Minister's Office had said.

268.title: Happiness more important than any title: Nadal on pulling out of Wimbledon
268.article_body: Having pulled out of Wimbledon 2022 before his semi-final against Nick Kyrgios due to an abdominal tear, Rafael Nadal said, "The most important thing is happiness more than any title." "I can't risk that match and stay two, three months [out] of the competition," added Nadal. "I am very sad and [this has]...been a very tough [decision]," he stated.

269.title: Bairstow is on hot streak; overshadowing Root: Vaughan
269.article_body: Former England skipper Michael Vaughan has said that English batter Jonny Bairstow is on a "hot streak". "Bairstow is currently going through the type of hot streak that batters only go through once or twice in their career...I experienced it in 2002-03," Vaughan said. "He [Bairstow] is overshadowing the greatest England batter [Joe Root] that I've ever seen," Vaughan added.

270.title: Twitter tests 'CoTweets' feature to let users co-author tweets
270.article_body: Twitter has started testing a feature called 'CoTweets' that will allow users to co-author tweets. The company said that a co-authored tweet, for which a user will have to send an invite to another, will appear on both authors' profiles with both usernames and profile pictures in the header. The test currently involves selected accounts from Canada, Korea and US.

271.title: Red alert in Mumbai, Thane as IMD predicts very heavy rainfall for 2 days
271.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert in Mumbai and adjoining areas for Friday and Saturday. It has predicted 'heavy to very heavy rainfall' in Mumbai, Thane, Palghar, Raigad, Ratnagiri and Sindhudurg for today. Moreover, an orange alert is in place till July 12, which may change depending upon the rainfall received during the next two days.

272.title: Disneyland's FB, Instagram accounts briefly hacked, racist posts made
272.article_body: Disneyland Resort's Facebook and Instagram accounts were briefly hacked on Thursday, the company said. As per the screenshots shared online, a person claiming to be a "super hacker" posted a number of racist and homophobic posts on these accounts. "We worked quickly to remove the reprehensible content, secure our accounts and our security teams are conducting an investigation," Disneyland said.

273.title: India reports 18,815 new COVID-19 cases, 38 deaths; active cases rise to 1,22,335
273.article_body: India has reported 18,815 COVID-19 cases, 15,899 recoveries and 38 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 18,930 cases and 35 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,22,335, while the death toll reached 5,25,343.

274.title: Ford, VW-backed self-driving startup Argo AI fires 150 employees
274.article_body: Argo AI, a US-based startup which works on self-driving vehicle technology, has fired around 150 employees. "We are making prudent adjustments to our business plan to best continue on a path for success," the company said on the job cuts. The startup, backed by Ford Motor Company and Volkswagen AG, has a global workforce of more than 2,000 employees.

275.title: The ultra-wealthy choose experts, now so can you: dezerv.
275.article_body: Indian HNI's have been investing through experts for generations as they understand the importance of financial expertise for growing their money, said wealthtech dezerv. This defined dezerv.'s mission: to help all working professionals access such experts who create & optimize high-performing investment portfolios. You can focus on what you do best while experts help secure your future, it added.

276.title: Steve Smith sells his 4-BHK mansion in Sydney for ₹67 crore
276.article_body: Australia cricketer Steve Smith has sold his mansion in Sydney for AU$12.38 million (over ₹67 crore), almost double what he paid for the property little more than two years ago. As many as four parties had registered to bid on the four-bedroom, three-bathroom house, with bidding getting opened with an offer of AU$11.5 million.

277.title: Mahindra's EV unit to raise $250 mn from UK's BII at $9.1 bn valuation
277.article_body: Mahindra and Mahindra and British International Investment (BII) will each invest up to $250 million in a new EV subsidiary of Mahindra at a valuation of $9.1 billion. BII's investment will result in a 2.75% to 4.76% stake in the business. Mahindra's shares rose to as much as 5.4% to a record high on Friday.

278.title: Sara Ali Khan, Kartik Aaryan were dating each other, confirms Karan Johar
278.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has confirmed that actors Sara Ali Khan and Kartik Aaryan were dating each other. Karan stated that Sara mentioned Kartik's name on his show 'Koffee with Karan' and they later started dating each other. "It's fantastic that this couch has actually manifested so many relationships!" Karan Johar said about his show.

279.title: CBI files FIR against Chitra, ex-Mumbai Police chief for tapping phones of NSE officials
279.article_body: The CBI has filed an FIR against former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey, former NSE head Ravi Narain and former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna for alleged phone tapping of NSE employees during 2009-2017. It said that Isec Securities Pvt Ltd, a company incorporated by Pandey in March 2001, conducted illegal surveillance of NSE employees on orders of NSE chiefs.

280.title: Odisha plans to give land titles to tribals under FRA by 2024
280.article_body: Odisha government is planning to give land titles to eligible tribals under Forest Rights Act (FRA) by 2024, ST and SC development department Principal Secretary Ranjana Chopra said. "[We are] also trying to create a digital footprint so that this ownership of land isn't lost in future," she added. "All tribals will be granted their rightful ownership," she further said.

281.title: Deeply distressed by the attack on my dear friend Shinzo Abe: PM Modi
281.article_body: After former Japan Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was shot during a speech in Nara city, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "Deeply distressed by the attack on my dear friend Abe Shinzo. Our thoughts and prayers are with him, his family, and the people of Japan." Abe was in the city to support a candidate in this weekend's Upper House election.

282.title: Single-use plastic ban a step towards building a sustainable planet: Bhupender Yadav
282.article_body: Union Cabinet Minister for Environment Bhupender Yadav said that the ban on single-use plastics is a significant step towards building a sustainable planet. "PM Narendra Modi-led government believes that development should not come at the cost of the environment," he added. "We can eliminate single-use plastics from our daily lives with everyone's participation and combined efforts," Yadav stated.

283.title: Shinzo Abe critical, doctors working very hard to save him: Japan PM
283.article_body: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has said that former PM Shinzo Abe is in critical condition. "It is barbaric and malicious and it cannot be tolerated. We will do everything we can. At this moment, doctors are working very hard to save Mr Abe," Kishida added. Abe was shot by a man from behind during a speech in Nara city.

284.title: We were sloppy, need to work on it: Rohit on 6 catches dropped in 1st T20I
284.article_body: Talking about the six catches dropped by the Indian fielders in the first T20I against England, India captain Rohit Sharma said, "We were sloppy in the field...Those catches should've been taken." "We'll look to work on it and come back stronger," added Rohit. Dinesh Karthik dropped three catches while Deepak Hooda, Suryakumar Yadav and Yuzvendra Chahal dropped a catch apiece.

285.title: Woman arrested for running prostitution racket in Hyderabad
285.article_body: A woman was arrested for allegedly running a prostitution racket in Hyderabad's Jawaharnagar area on Thursday. The accused, identified as Sirigadi Aruna, roped in women from Andhra Pradesh on the pretext of providing a livelihood and forced them into prostitution. Aruna is already under trial for human trafficking. She has been reportedly involved in these crimes since 2019.

286.title: Priyanka to play Mindy Kaling's Punjabi cousin in upcoming H'wood rom-com
286.article_body: Priyanka Chopra will be seen playing the role of Mindy Kaling's Punjabi cousin in their upcoming Hollywood rom-com, which will revolve around a big fat Indian wedding. Mindy said Priyanka will play a Punjabi Indian from India in the film, while she'll play an Indian American Bengali woman from the East Coast. The project will mark their first collaboration together.

287.title: He swings the ball in all conditions: Buttler on Bhuvneshwar's 1/10
287.article_body: England's white-ball skipper Jos Buttler said Team India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar can swing the ball in all conditions, following his spell of 1/10 in the first T20I against England. "Certainly the ball swung longer than I can remember in a T20 game," added Buttler. Bhuvneshwar had an economy rate of 3.33 and dismissed Buttler for a golden duck.

288.title: Bangladeshi murder accused on run for 7 years arrested in Bengaluru
288.article_body: A Bangladeshi national, who was on the run after being accused of murdering a blogger in Sylhet in 2015, was arrested in Bengaluru, officials said on Thursday. The murder accused, identified as Faisal Ahmed, had illegally crossed into India and was working as a cab driver in Bengaluru, police said. The police added that Ahmed allegedly has links to Al-Qaeda.

289.title: It's going to be a tsunami at the box office: Johar on SRK's 'Pathaan'
289.article_body: Karan Johar, speaking about Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'Pathaan', said, "When Pathaan...[comes], it's going to be a tsunami at box office." "Shah Rukh has kept people waiting...and the more they wait, the more they'll...give back in terms of love, to I believe the biggest star of our country," he added. 'Pathaan' is slated to release on January 25, 2023.

290.title: Ex-Sena MLA, 8 policemen booked for assaulting Dalit man in Pune
290.article_body: Former Shiv Sena MLA Mahadev Babar and eight police personnel have been booked for allegedly assaulting a Dalit man during a bandh last year in Pune. Babar and some others had reportedly forced the complainant to shut his sister's fish stall and thrashed him. Later, when the complainant went to Kondhwa police station, the accused police officers apparently beat him.

291.title: Extreme unemployment: Chidambaram on applications received under Agnipath
291.article_body: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram on Thursday said that "extreme unemployment situation" in the country was the reason behind the Indian Air Force (IAF) receiving 7.5 lakh applications under Agnipath scheme. "Wrong conclusion: the Agniveer scheme is popular among...youth," he tweeted, adding that the correct conclusion would be the unemployment, which is driving desperate youth to take any job.

292.title: Man who shot former Japan PM Shinzo Abe identified; pic of arrest surfaces
292.article_body: The man who shot former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has been identified as 41-year-old Yamagami Tetsuya. Pictures of the attacker's arrest surfaced on social media. Abe was making a speech for an election campaign in Nara city when he was shot from behind by the attacker, local media said.

293.title: Rohit Sharma creates world record for most T20I wins in a row as captain
293.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has created a world record after India defeated England by 50 runs in the first T20I. Rohit has become the first captain in the history of men's T20I cricket to win 13 matches in a row. The previous record of 12 consecutive victories as captain was held jointly by Afghanistan's Asghar Afghan and Romania's Ramesh Satheesan.

294.title: UP man shares video threatening to behead Nupur Sharma, arrested
294.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly Police on Thursday arrested a man who allegedly threatened to behead suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma over her remarks against Prophet Muhammad. This comes after a video of the accused issuing the threats was shared on social media. "We've arrested the accused for issuing threats online...trying to incite communal tensions...he was arrested from his house," police said.

295.title: My political & social tenure is not yet over: Naqvi after resignation
295.article_body: Senior BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi, who resigned as Union Minority Affairs Minister recently, said his political journey is not yet over. "I understand that my tenure in Rajya Sabha has been completed, but my political and social tenure has not yet been completed," he said. "I will continue to work with dedication and concern for society," Naqvi added.

296.title: Huawei India sent ₹750 crore to parent firm in China to evade taxes: I-T Dept
296.article_body: The Income Tax Department has alleged that Huawei India transferred ₹750 crore to its parent company in China in the form of dividends to evade taxes. It further said that the company made these transfers in two years even as its revenues drastically fell in India. The I-T Department froze Huawei's bank accounts in February after raids at its premises.

297.title: IMD issues red alert for Goa; schools closed for 2 days for Classes 1-8
297.article_body: After India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a red alert warning for Friday in Goa, the government directed schools to remain closed for Classes 1-8 on Friday and Saturday. IMD issued an orange alert for July 7, 9 and 10 and a red alert for July 8 in Goa. "Possibility of very heavy rainfall...for five days," IMD said on Thursday.

298.title: Ronaldo must be thinking 'When will Man Utd start making moves': Rio
298.article_body: Ex-Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said his former team's forward Cristiano Ronaldo must be wondering about when the Red Devils will start making transfers. "Seeing Manchester City signing Erling Haaland...[and] Liverpool signing Darwin Núñez...he would be thinking 'They are jumping even further away,'" added Ferdinand. United finished sixth on the Premier League points table last season.

299.title: Trump was removed as director of his media group in June: Report
299.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump was removed as a director from the board of his media firm Trump Media & Technology Group last month, Reuters reported citing filings. The removal took place weeks before TMTG was served with subpoenas from federal authorities. The US SEC, which has been probing TMTG's deal with Digital World, sent TMTG a subpoena in June.

300.title: 4 friends lose ₹20 lakh, 2 cars, bike to fraudsters in Gurugram
300.article_body: Four friends were allegedly cheated of ₹20 lakh, two cars and a bike by three fraudsters after the latter promised to get them jobs at AIIMS, Delhi. The four victims, who are residents of Nai Basti in Gurugram's Sector-8, were even provided with fake joining letters, police said. The victims are Hitesh Rai, Vikram Chauhan, Ajay Kumar and Vijay Kumar.

301.title: Centre creating 'economic blockade' for West Bengal: CM Mamata Banerjee
301.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday claimed that the central government is creating an "economic blockade" for the state by not releasing funds for MGNREGA and other schemes. "UGC grants have also been stopped and is causing trouble to PhD students doing research," Mamata added. She was speaking at a programme held to distribute students' credit cards in Kolkata.

302.title: Mobile thief forgets to switch off stolen handset in Mumbai; arrested
302.article_body: A 20-year-old mobile thief from Mumbai's Borivali West was arrested after he allegedly forgot to switch off a stolen handset before burying it in his chawl's backyard. Police tracked the accused, who used to steal mobile phones and later sell them on the black market, using mobile tower location. He had successfully stayed off the police radar for four years.

303.title: Govt didn't give proper reasons: Twitter as it challenges 39 blocking orders by IT Min
303.article_body: Twitter is challenging around 39 blocking orders issued by the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology in the Karnataka High Court. Arguing that the government didn’t provide "proper reasons" for issuing the blocking orders and has been "increasingly" doing so, it said that between February 2021 and 2022, it was asked to take down 1,474 accounts and 175 tweets.

304.title: Video shows the moment former Japan PM Abe was shot at during speech
304.article_body: A video showing the moment former Japan PM Shinzo Abe was shot during a speech in the city of Nara has surfaced on social media. Police have arrested a man on suspicion of attempted murder and retrieved a gun, local media reported. Abe has been taken to a hospital and his condition remains unknown.

305.title: James Caan, best known for playing Sonny Corleone in 'The Godfather', dies at 82
305.article_body: American actor James Caan, known for playing Sonny Corleone in 'The Godfather', died aged 82. "Jimmy was one of the greatest. Not only was he one of the best actors our business has ever seen, he was funny, loyal, caring and beloved," his manager Matt DelPiano said. Caan, who also appeared in 'Misery', 'Thief' and 'Rollerball', was an Oscar nominee.

306.title: 9-month-old dies due to COVID-19 in Mumbai, youngest this year in city
306.article_body: After a gap of 22 days, two COVID-19 deaths were reported in Mumbai on Thursday. One of these deaths was that of a nine-month-old baby with heart disease and down syndrome. This is reportedly the youngest death in the city so far this year. Mumbai has reported 28 deaths in the 0-9 age group ever since the coronavirus pandemic began.

307.title: 9 dead, 1 rescued alive after car washes away in river in Uttarakhand
307.article_body: At least nine persons died after a car got washed away in the Dhela river in Uttarakhand's Ramnagar amid a heavy flow of water due to rains on Friday morning, Kumaon Range DIG Nilesh Bharne said. About five persons are trapped and one girl has been rescued alive, he added. Efforts are on to identify all the dead, Bharne stated.

308.title: CoinSwitch CFO, Senior VP, 2 others quit firm to start Web3 venture
308.article_body: CoinSwitch Kuber's CFO Sarmad Nazki, Chief Business Officer Sharan Nair, Senior VP Krishna Hegde and Yadunandan Batchu, a senior blockchain engineer, have quit the firm to start their own Web3 venture. "We...have not zeroed in on an idea for the startup yet," Nair said. "I'm happy to see Sharan, Sarmad and Krishna spread out," CoinSwitch CEO Ashish Singhal said.

309.title: 32 Sena corporators from Navi Mumbai meet Shinde, extend support
309.article_body: As many as 32 Shiv Sena corporators from Navi Mumbai met with Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Thursday and extended their support to him. This comes after 66 of the party's corporators from Thane joined Shinde's camp. "[Shinde] never declined anybody's phone call. Even if an ordinary party worker calls him up, he receives...call," the Navi Mumbai corporators said.

310.title: 76 traffic junctions in Noida being put under ITMS surveillance
310.article_body: Almost 76 traffic junctions in Noida have been put under intelligent traffic management system (ITMS) surveillance in order to identify traffic violators. The traffic police, which used ITMS on trial for the past two months, can issue e-challans with the help of ITMS. Notably, the traffic junctions include Okhla Bird Sanctuary Metro Station, Amrapali Chowk and Atta Chowk Gol Chakkar.

311.title: Twitter says it removes over 1 million spam accounts daily, Musk reacts
311.article_body: Twitter removes over 1 million spam accounts daily, said executives on Thursday amid a report that Tesla CEO Elon Musk may drop the $44 billion deal over fake accounts' data. Reacting to this, Dogecoin's Co-founder Billy Markus remarked, "How many new real accounts does it have per day I wonder," to which Musk replied, "That is indeed the real question."

312.title: Heavy rains, thunderstorms in Kerala for next 5 days; yellow alert issued
312.article_body: Kerala government has warned of heavy rains and thunderstorms for the next five days in the state. A yellow alert has been issued for Friday and Saturday in all districts except Thiruvananthapuram and Kollam. "There are reports that the water level in the Kadalundi, Bharathapuzha, Shiriya, Karuvannur and Gayathri rivers of northern Kerala is rising," Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said.

313.title: Bhopal Police issues look out circular against 'Kaali' director
313.article_body: Bhopal Police issued a look out circular against 'Kaali' director Leena Manimekalai over her film's poster showing a woman dressed as the Hindu goddess smoking a cigarette. This comes after Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said he will write to the Centre to issue a look out circular against her. UP and Delhi Police earlier filed FIRs against Manimekalai.

314.title: Woman found dead at construction site in Mumbai, 2 suspects arrested
314.article_body: A 32-year-old woman was found dead at an under-construction site in Mumbai's Andheri on Wednesday. Police have arrested two suspects, both natives of West Bengal, in connection with the case. The woman had reportedly been dead for two days, however, the death came to light when the supervisor found her and the suspects to be missing from work, police said.

315.title: Actor Richard Gere attends Dalai Lama's 87th b'day celebration in Dharamshala
315.article_body: Hollywood actor Richard Gere attended Dalai Lama's 87th birthday celebration in Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh on Wednesday. "I was able to meet his Holiness Dalai Lama in Dharamshala 40 years ago, which clearly changed my life," Gere said. Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur also joined the celebration through video conferencing.

316.title: GameStop fires CFO Recupero, laying off several employees: Report
316.article_body: Video game retailer GameStop has fired its Chief Financial Officer Mike Recupero, Reuters reported. Following the news, the shares of the firm fell 8% in extended trading. Axios, which first reported Recupero's exit, cited a memo and reported that the firm is laying off an undisclosed number of employees. Recupero will be replaced by Chief Accounting Officer Diana Saadeh-Jajeh.

317.title: Mysterious fireball spotted over New Zealand, explosions heard; pic surfaces
317.article_body: New Zealanders across the North Island reported a mysterious fireball and a huge flash of light streaking across the sky on Thursday afternoon. They also reported rumbling and crackling sounds. A plumber named Curtis Powell captured the phenomenon on his dashcam while driving. He called it a "once-in-a-lifetime" spectacle.

318.title: B'luru police arrest 1 drug smuggler, seize drugs worth ₹80 lakh
318.article_body: Bengaluru City Police's Central Crime Branch has arrested a man allegedly involved in drug smuggling in the KR Puram Police Station limits, Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime) Raman Gupta said on Thursday. The police also seized prohibited drugs worth ₹80 lakh. Earlier, police had arrested two drug peddlers from Sanjay Nagar and seized drugs and two phones worth ₹3 lakh.

319.title: Musk's Twitter deal in 'jeopardy', he has 'stopped funding discussions': Report
319.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk may walk away from the $44 billion agreement to buy Twitter as he doesn’t believe he has enough information on the number of fake accounts on Twitter, as per a report. According to The Washington Post report, the deal is "in serious jeopardy" and Musk has "stopped engaging in certain discussions around funding" for it.

320.title: Haryana BJP's IT cell chief removed after his 2017 tweet against Islam resurfaces
320.article_body: The BJP on Thursday removed its Haryana IT cell incharge Arun Yadav amid growing calls for his arrest over a 2017 tweet against Islam. "With over 85,000 tweets seeking his arrest, it has become a big issue," a BJP leader said. However, no police complaint has been filed against Yadav yet.

321.title: 22-yr-old man arrested in Hyderabad for selling banned e-cigarettes
321.article_body: The Hyderabad Commissioner's Task Force along with the Begumpet Police arrested a 22-year-old man for illegally selling e-cigarettes and seized material worth ₹2.5 lakh from him. According to police, the accused, identified as Chinmai Katari, is a resident of Rasoolpura, Begumpet. He used to procure the banned items from Mumbai and sell them via social media platforms, police added.

322.title: Former Japan PM Shinzo Abe shot at while giving speech
322.article_body: Former Japan Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has been shot during a speech in the city of Nara, according to reports. Abe was reportedly attacked by a man from behind while he was delivering the speech on a street. Police said that they have captured the man and are questioning him, according to reports.

323.title: 45-year-old doctor rapes minor girl at his clinic in Pune; booked
323.article_body: A 45-year-old doctor was booked on Thursday for allegedly raping a minor girl, who's now aged 19,  at his clinic in Pune between November 2019 and December 2020. The accused also reportedly took the girl's nude pictures and threatened to make them viral if she told anyone. The girl had gone to the clinic to get treatment for spinal disease.

324.title: Maximum number of dangerous buildings in North Delhi: MCD survey
324.article_body: The maximum number of dangerous buildings in the national capital is in North Delhi, as per a Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) survey. In South Delhi, only one building was found to be in dangerous condition while none were found in East Delhi. At least 112 dangerous buildings were found in the City Sadar Paharganj zone as of July 1.

325.title: Tesla crash that killed pedestrian under special probe in US
325.article_body: The US NHTSA has opened a special probe into a Tesla crash that killed a pedestrian in California. The crash involved a 2018 Tesla Model 3, suspected of being driven using the advanced driver assistance system. On June 7, a Tesla car reportedly went airborne and struck and killed a woman. A 39-year-old man was reportedly charged with vehicular manslaughter.

326.title: 35% of Mumbai population lives near chronic flooding hotspots: Data
326.article_body: Over 35% of Mumbai's population is estimated to be living within 250 metres of known chronic flooding hotspots, an analysis by World Resources Institute (India) revealed. Furthermore, it was revealed that less than half of the city's population has easy access to flood shelters during periods of heavy rain. Amid heavy rains, an orange alert has been issued for Mumbai.

327.title: India win 18th int'l match in a row under Rohit's captaincy, beat England in 1st T20I
327.article_body: India defeated England by 50 runs in the first T20I in Southampton. It's India's 18th victory in a row in international cricket under the captaincy of Rohit Sharma. All-rounder Hardik Pandya slammed his first-ever T20I fifty to help India put up a total of 198/8. He also took four wickets as England were bowled out for 148 in 19.3 overs.

328.title: India qualify for cross-over round in women's hockey WC despite 3-4 defeat against NZ
328.article_body: India qualified for the cross-over round despite losing 3-4 against New Zealand in their last Pool B match in women's hockey World Cup 2022. New Zealand topped the group and directly qualified for the quarter-finals. Meanwhile, India will face Spain or South Korea in cross-over round on Sunday. India will qualify for the quarter-finals if they win the cross-over round.

329.title: Nadal withdraws from Wimbledon semi-final due to abdominal tear, Kyrgios reaches final
329.article_body: Twenty two-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal has withdrawn from Wimbledon 2022 due to an abdominal tear. Nadal was due to face Nick Kyrgios in men's singles semi-final on Friday. With Nadal withdrawing from the tournament, Kyrgios has received a walkover into the final. It will be the first time Kyrgios will be featuring in a Grand Slam final.

330.title: It's raining discounts up to 60% off at Grand Fashion Sale: Pantaloons
330.article_body: Pantaloons has revealed that its Grand Fashion Sale has grabbed all the eyeballs in the town and is here for you to shop until you drop. Kurtas, tops, jeans and joggers - why to choose one when you can have them all, said the brand, adding that customers can avail discounts up to 60% off on all the trendiest collections.

331.title: UK warship seized Iranian missiles headed for Yemen: Britain
331.article_body: A British Royal Navy vessel captured a consignment of Iranian missiles in the Gulf of Oman early in 2022, UK officials said on Thursday, suggesting Tehran's support for Yemen's Houthi rebels in the war-torn country. The seized equipment included surface-to-air missiles and engines for cruise missiles. Iran's mission to the United Nations rejected the UK's findings as "groundless".

332.title: 3 pvt banks allowed to provide services for defence procurement
332.article_body: The Centre has allowed three private-sector banks, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank and Axis Bank, to provide financial services for overseas procurement by the Defence Ministry. Until now, only public-sector banks were allowed to offer these services. The banks may be allocated with LC business of ₹2,000 crore for one year, each on the capital and revenue side, the ministry said.

333.title: InsuranceDekho raises $100 million in latest funding round: Report
333.article_body: Insurance aggregator InsuranceDekho has raised $100 million in its latest funding round, YourStory reported. The Gurugram-headquartered startup was launched by automobile aggregator CarDekho in 2019 to make it easier for customers to compare and buy motor and health insurance. The platform has since expanded into other forms of insurance like life, term and retirement plans.

334.title: 10 lakh students out of schools in K'taka: Survey submitted in HC
334.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has been informed that more than 10 lakh students below the age of 14 have been out of schools and anganwadis in the state. A PIL was presented in the court on the basis of a survey. Over 15,000 students between the ages of 6-14 years were out of school and more than 10,000 never enrolled.

335.title: Brittney Griner pleads guilty to drug possession in Moscow trial
335.article_body: Jailed American basketball player Brittney Griner on Thursday pled guilty to possession and smuggling of drugs during her trial in Moscow but maintained no criminal intent. According to Russian media, Griner said she acted unintentionally as she had packed in haste. Griner was detained at the Moscow airport in February after cannabis oil was allegedly found in her luggage.

336.title: IIM Bangalore graduates' startup BuildNext raises $3.5 million
336.article_body: Proptech startup BuildNext, founded by IIM Bangalore graduates Gopikrishnan V and Finaz Naha, has raised $3.5 million in its pre-Series A funding round. The funding round was led by Madhumala Ventures, a subsidiary of Pidilite Industries and saw participation from Konglo Ventures, Vineet Kumar (CEO, Native) and Deep Gupta (FatEngine). The Kerala-based startup was incorporated in 2015.

337.title: Ethnic wear brand Libas looks to raise ₹150-200 cr for expansion
337.article_body: Ethnic wear brand Libas is looking to raise ₹150-200 crore through private equity for expansion of its offline presence. Sidhant Keshwani, CEO and Managing Director of Libas, said that they are in discussions with private equity firms and will announce a fund infusion soon. He further added that the company is targeting a revenue of ₹470-500 crore this fiscal.

338.title: RBI forex measures to impact flow positively: Economic Affairs Secy
338.article_body: Economic Affairs Secretary Ajay Seth on Thursday said the measures announced by the RBI on Wednesday to enhance foreign exchange inflows will have a "positive" impact on flows. "In the overseas NDF (non-deliverable forwards) market, the rupee has appreciated," he stated. This comes after the rupee hit an all-time low of 79.37 against the US dollar on Tuesday.

339.title: 77% weekly increase in number of monkeypox cases: WHO
339.article_body: The World Health Organization on Thursday said there was a 77% weekly increase in the number of monkeypox cases worldwide, taking the total caseload to over 6,000 which includes three deaths. The increase in cases was reported mostly from Europe and Africa. The health agency said the disease is mainly found among men who have had sex with other men.

340.title: Stalin congratulates PT Usha, Ilaiyaraaja on Rajya Sabha nomination
340.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has extended greetings to athlete PT Usha and music icon Ilaiyaraaja on their Rajya Sabha nomination. "Congratulations to PT Usha on being nominated to the Council of States," Stalin tweeted. Stalin also congratulated the music maestro for his upcoming stint in the Rajya Sabha. Ilaiyaraaja thanked Stalin for the wishes.

341.title: Terrorist linked Al-Badr arrested in Jammu & Kashmir's Awantipora
341.article_body: A terrorist linked to outfit Al-Badr was arrested in Jammu and Kashmir's Awantipora by the police. Upon getting information, J&K police along with the Army and CRPF officials established a joint checkpoint in the area. The terrorist, identified as Aamir Ahmed Parray, was arrested during the check. A pistol and four pistol rounds were recovered from his possession.

342.title: Jamia Millia's offline classes to start from July 16
342.article_body: Jamia Millia Islamia on Thursday said their offline classes will start from July 16, except for first semester/year students for whom classes will begin from August 1. The ongoing admission process will close on July 31. Examinations will be held from December 1 to 15 and the winter break will be from December 23 to January 1, 2023.

343.title: Climate tech startup Climes raises $1.2 mn from Sequoia, others
343.article_body: Climate tech startup Climes has raised $1.2 million in a funding round led by Sequoia Capital India, Kalaari Capital, Avaana Capital and Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath. Climes will use the raised capital to integrate with different brands and enable a pathway for companies to become climate leaders. It'll also upgrade its tech stack to enable quick adoption of climate solutions.

344.title: Nykaa parent shares surge 5% after men's innerwear brand launch
344.article_body: The shares of Nykaa's parent company, FSN E-Commerce Ventures, surged around 5% on Thursday. On BSE, its stock hit an intraday high of ₹1,469.85. This comes after the company announced the launch of its first innerwear and athleisure brand for men called GLOOT. Nykaa Fashion said GLOOT is a "highly intelligent" tech creation that will provide anti-stain and anti-odour products.

345.title: Ukrainian Prez expresses 'sadness' at Boris Johnson's resignation
345.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday called Boris Johnson to express his "sadness" over the British leader's resignation as the PM of the UK. "Not only me, but...the entire Ukrainian society...is very sympathetic to you," he said. "We have no doubt that Great Britain's support will be preserved, but your personal leadership and charisma made it special," he added.

346.title: Map industrial activities for Gati Shakti scheme: FM to NITI Aayog
346.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday asked the NITI Aayog to prepare a report mapping all industrial activities, including defence corridors and pharma hubs, so that they can be incorporated under the PM Gati Shakti scheme. "I find many of them still lying loose and unconnected," she stated, while adding, "Mapping it up will probably give a better idea."

347.title: SoftBank's Rajeev Misra steps down from main roles to launch own fund
347.article_body: Rajeev Misra is stepping back from his main roles at SoftBank Group to launch his own venture fund, reports said. Misra will retain his role overseeing the first $100 billion Vision Fund but will cede his frontline role in managing the second Vision Fund. He's reportedly secured over $6 billion in backing for his fund, including from Middle East investors.

348.title: Meta builds new AI model which can translate 200 languages
348.article_body: Meta, the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, announced that it has built a new AI model which can translate 200 different languages. The model, built under Meta's 'No Language Left Behind' project, aims to enable over 25 billion translations across the company's apps daily. This comes after Meta was accused of failing to moderate harmful content in some languages.

349.title: 24-yr-old biker dies after truck hits him in Thane
349.article_body: A 24-year-old biker was killed after a trailer truck hit him from behind in Bhiwandi, Thane, on Wednesday night. Police filed a case of death by negligence against the unidentified truck driver, who escaped the scene after the accident. The accused driver was allegedly speeding, an official said.

350.title: Rohit breaks Kohli's record, becomes fastest to reach 1,000 T20I runs as India captain
350.article_body: India skipper Rohit Sharma on Thursday broke ex-India captain Virat Kohli's record for being the fastest Indian batter to reach 1,000 runs in T20I cricket as captain.
