With his 24(14) against England in the first T20I, Rohit crossed 1,000 T20I runs in 29 innings as captain. Kohli had taken 30 T20I innings to reach the 1,000-run mark as captain.

351.title: India elected to UNESCO panel on Intangible Cultural Heritage
351.article_body: India has been elected to the Intergovernmental Committee of UNESCO's 2003 Convention for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage (ICH) for the 2022-2026 cycle, Union Minister G Kishan Reddy announced on Thursday. As the nation celebrates Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, India will be a part of two prominent Committees of UNESCO - ICH and World Heritage, he said.

352.title: KTR inaugurates Safran's electrical and power factory in Hyderabad
352.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao inaugurated French aerospace major Safran's electrical and power factory in Hyderabad on Thursday. "For the first time the group has decided to venture...in India and we're glad that you found Hyderabad to be the best ecosystem for setting up your...factories," KTR said. Aircraft engine facility will be set up with a 36 million-euro investment.

353.title: Development isn't 'chamak-dhamak' but empowerment of poor: PM Modi
353.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday addressed a gathering in Varanasi, stating that development doesn't mean "chamak-damak" (glitter) but rather empowerment of the poor and deprived communities. He added that the government is working on providing piped water access to every household and building pucca houses. PM's remarks came after he laid foundation stones of projects worth ₹1,774 crore at event.

354.title: Spain's Pamplona hosts 1st bull-running festival since 2019
354.article_body: The first bull run since 2019 took place on Thursday at the San Fermín festival in Spain's Pamplona. Several runners were stomped, trampled or shoved to the cobblestone pavement during the run. "The energy is awesome - this is the greatest party, the greatest thing I've ever seen in my life," a tourist from Hawaii said.

355.title: My focus wasn't COVID-19: Alia on staying with Neetu after Rishi Kapoor's death
355.article_body: Alia Bhatt recalled staying with Neetu Kapoor after Rishi Kapoor's demise in 2020. She said, "I remember...April, May, June, my focus was not...on COVID...because we, as a family, were dealing with Rishi uncle's passing away...So, that was like...bang in the middle of the pandemic." "Post that it was spending time with Ranbir's mum...so that we could...be around her," she added.

356.title: 96% of Portugal is experiencing drought
356.article_body: Portugal is experiencing one of its worst drought spells, with 96% of the country declared to be under "extreme" or "severe" drought conditions. The temperatures in some parts of the country are expected to touch 43°C over this weekend. Government bodies have readied emergency teams as a third of the country is at risk of forest fires, officials said.

357.title: Actor-politician Raj Babbar gets 2-yr jail term for assaulting a polling officer in 1996
357.article_body: A Lucknow court has sentenced actor and Congress leader Raj Babbar to two years in jail for assaulting a polling officer in 1996 while contesting from Samajwadi Party. Babbar was convicted for voluntarily causing hurt to deter a public servant from performing his duty and three other offences. The court has also imposed a fine of ₹8,500 on him.

358.title: 10-month-old gets Railways' compassionate appointment after parents die
358.article_body: The Railways has given a compassionate appointment to a 10-month-old girl after her parents died in an accident in Chhattisgarh, officials said. She can work for Railways after turning 18 years of age. The girl's father, Rajendra Kumar, worked as an assistant at a railway yard in Bhilai. He, along with his wife, was killed in an accident in June.

359.title: Licences of country liquor suppliers extended in Delhi
359.article_body: Delhi government has extended the licences of country liquor suppliers by a month, as per an official notification. The licence-holders have been asked to pay pro-rata license fee for one month. While the Excise Policy of 2022-23 was approved by the Delhi government on May 5, it is yet to be approved by the Lieutenant Governor.

360.title: Police book man for stabbing food cart vendor in the neck in Guj
360.article_body: Police have booked a man who allegedly stabbed a food cart vendor multiple times in the neck for refusing to serve bread-omelette in Gujarat's Visnagar. As per the police, the accused Bhavik Patel approached food-cart vendor Nagjibhai Baldevbhai and attacked him when Nagjibhai said he ran out of bread. The Police have lodged a case under IPC section 307.

361.title: Sikhs, Hindus donate to family of Kabul gurdwara attack victim
361.article_body: Minority Afghan Sikhs and Hindus have donated 1 lakh afghani (around ₹90,000) to the relatives of the Muslim security guard who died in the terror attack on a gurdwara in Kabul last month. In the June 18 terror attack, two persons were shot dead. The Taliban government released 11 lakh afghani (₹9.72 lakh) for each of the deceased.

362.title: Federal Bank appoints MVS Murthy as its 1st Chief Marketing Officer
362.article_body: Federal Bank has appointed MVS Murthy as its first Chief Marketing Officer (CMO). Prior to being appointed at Federal Bank, Murthy was heading marketing, digital and corporate communication at TATA AMC. "We're happy to welcome MVS to the Federal family...I'm certain his vast experience will strengthen our brand positioning," said Federal Bank Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO) Ajith Kumar KK.

363.title: Cong has been constantly attacking constitutional institutions: Rijiju
363.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju criticised Congress and said the party has been constantly attacking constitutional institutions from the beginning. "Don't forget that people of India are not servants of anyone," Rijiju tweeted. Rijiju's comment comes a day after Congress' Abhishek Singhvi accused the BJP of promoting personal attacks on Supreme Court judges.

364.title: BSF nabs 4 Pakistani fishermen from creek area in Gujarat's Kutch
364.article_body: A BSF patrol on Thursday caught four Pakistani fishermen and seized their 10 boats off the coast of Kutch in Gujarat along the India-Pakistan maritime border, a force spokesperson said. Nothing suspicious was recovered from the boats, the spokesperson said, adding that fishermen were trying to sneak "into Indian territory" through one of the water channels of 'Harami Nalla' creek.

365.title: Delhi reports 579 new COVID-19 cases and 1 death in last 24 hours
365.article_body: Delhi reported 579 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the health department said on Thursday. The national capital also reported one COVID-19-related death, while 688 people recovered from the virus in the last 24 hours. Delhi's positivity rate now stands at 3.46% and there are currently 2,480 active coronavirus patients in the city.

366.title: Court sends 7 accused in Amravati chemist's killing to NIA custody
366.article_body: A special court in Mumbai on Thursday remanded seven persons arrested in connection with the killing of an Amravati-based chemist in the custody of National Investigation Agency (NIA) till July 15. Umesh Kolhe was stabbed to death after he shared a WhatsApp post supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. Kolhe was on his way home when he was attacked.

367.title: 18-yr-old medical aspirant kills self in TN after finding NEET too hard
367.article_body: An 18-year-old boy preparing for National Eligibility-cum-Entrance Test (NEET) allegedly died by suicide after finding the exam too hard. The boy, who completed Class 12 last year, failed the exam in his previous attempt. Police said they found a note in his room that stated that he tried his best but felt he wouldn't be able to score enough marks.

368.title: India's playing XI for first T20I against England announced
368.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bat first against England in the first T20I at The Rose Bowl in Southampton. Rohit and Ishan Kishan will open the batting for India. India's playing XI also includes Deepak Hooda, Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya. Meanwhile, Arshdeep Singh is making his India debut today.

369.title: Curbing global warming can cut Indian fossil fuel revenues: Report
369.article_body: In its efforts to limit global warming to 1.5 °C, India's fossil fuel revenues can drop around 65% of the 2019 levels by 2050, a report by the International Institute for Sustainable Development (IISD) said. Revenues from coal production can fall 15%, it added. India's fossil fuel revenues were $92.9 billion in 2019, accounting for 18% of total government revenues.

370.title: Arshdeep becomes India's 99th T20I cricketer, pics from cap presentation ceremony surface
370.article_body: Fast bowler Arshdeep Singh has become the 99th cricketer to represent India in T20I cricket. The 23-year-old received his debut cap from captain Rohit Sharma, with pictures from the cap presentation ceremony surfacing online. Arshdeep has played 49 T20 matches so far, taking 52 wickets. He represents Punjab in domestic cricket and Punjab Kings in IPL.

371.title: IndiGo hikes pilot, crew salaries after reported mass leave on Air India hiring day
371.article_body: IndiGo has hiked the salaries of its pilots and cabin crew by a further 8%, days after reports said that the airline's staff took mass sick leave to attend Air India's recruitment drive. The airline will also reinstate layover and deadhead allowances for pilots and crew from July 31. Crew unavailability had caused delays for hundreds of IndiGo flights recently.

372.title: Pankaj to play Atal Bihari Vajpayee in former Prime Minister's biopic: Reports
372.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi will reportedly play former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee in the film titled Main Rahoon Ya Na Rahoon, Yeh Desh Rehna Chahiye, Atal. It is an adaptation of Ullekh NP’s book The Untold Vajpayee: Politician and Paradox. Reportedly, the film on Atal Bihari Vajpayee will be produced by Vinod Bhanushali, Sandeep Singh, Kamlesh Bhanushali and Vishal Gurnani.

373.title: Centre releases ₹324 crore from SDRF for Assam flood relief aid
373.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Thursday thanked PM Narendra Modi for releasing ₹324.40 crore from State Disaster Response Fund (SDRF) in advance, stating that the amount would benefit the state. Over 170 people have died in the state due to torrential rains. Notably, Assam and Meghalaya recorded the highest June rainfall since 1966, IMD said.

374.title: Orange alert issued for Himachal, heavy rain likely in next 2 days
374.article_body: IMD has issued an orange weather alert for the next two days in Himachal Pradesh. "Heavy-very heavy rain with thunderstorm and lightning is likely to take place on Friday and Saturday...causing flash floods and triggering landslides," Shimla MeT centre Director Surender Paul said. Reportedly, 49 people died in rain-related mishaps in Himachal since the onset of monsoon on June 29.

375.title: My romance with Ranbir started due to a faulty plane seat: Alia Bhatt
375.article_body: In her appearance on Koffee With Karan season 7, Alia Bhatt revealed how the romance started between her and Ranbir due to a faulty plane seat. "[Ranbir]...was supposed to sit next to me...But...something got stuck on his seat," she added. "I was like, 'Why is this happening, why is my dream getting shattered?' But later...he came back," Alia said.

376.title: Tricolour to be hoisted at every house in Haryana from August 11-17
376.article_body: The Haryana government has launched a campaign to ensure that each house in Haryana should have the national flag hoisted from August 11-17. "This is a national festival and all the citizens of the country are fortunate that they are getting the auspicious opportunity to hoist the tricolour at their homes," said Chief Secretary Sanjeev Kaushal.

377.title: Didn’t ask for info on those giving beheading calls against Hindus: NIA
377.article_body: The NIA on Thursday denied having asked people to inform it about anyone giving 'beheading' calls against Hindus in connection with the controversial remarks made by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. "Such messages are totally fake and malicious and are part of a mischievous design to mislead the public," NIA said in a statement.

378.title: Our missile strike killed Ukrainian troops on Snake Island: Russia
378.article_body: Russian Defence Ministry has said that its warplane struck and killed an unspecified number of Ukrainian troops on Snake Island in the Black Sea on Thursday. The troops had landed there to raise Ukraine's flag. Ukraine said earlier that its military forced Russia to retreat from Snake Island, while Russia claims it pulled out from the territory as "goodwill gesture".

379.title: China's Xiaomi produces first smartphones in Vietnam
379.article_body: China's Xiaomi Corporation on Thursday said that it has produced its first batch of smartphones in Vietnam. The smartphones were produced in Thai Nguyen in a factory operated by Xiaomi's partner DBG Technology. The devices have been sent to a Vietnamese distributor, Xiaomi said, adding that it would soon export smartphones to other Southeast Asian markets, including Malaysia and Thailand.

380.title: Unhelpful: India as it responds to Germany's comments on Mohammed Zubair's arrest
380.article_body: The Centre reacted to Germany's remarks on Mohammed Zubair's arrest and said, "This is our internal matter...Any comment on it is unhelpful. It's not right." "Matter is before the court. Our legal system is independent," it added. "India describes itself as the world's largest democracy. So one can expect democratic values like freedom of expression," Germany Foreign Ministry had said.

381.title: Facebook asks US court for FTC merger papers amid antitrust lawsuit
381.article_body: Meta's Facebook has asked an American court for eight documents created by the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to review the company's purchases of Instagram and WhatsApp. This comes amid FTC's antitrust lawsuit against Facebook. Facebook claimed the documents would reveal that FTC had earlier determined that the acquisitions were unlikely to lessen competition or harm consumers.

382.title: Tender for 200 4th-generation Vande Bharat trains by Aug: Report
382.article_body: Indian Railways is in the final stages of readying a tender to manufacture the fourth-generation Vande Bharat trains, a senior official told Moneycontrol. They said, "The bidding documents for the fourth generation of 200 Vande Bharat trains have been finalised...We're planning to float the tender by August." India plans to manufacture 400 Vande Bharat trains in the next three years.

383.title: Nitin Gadkari awarded honorary degree of Doctor of Science in Maha
383.article_body: Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari was conferred the honorary degree of Doctor of Science by Dr Panjabrao Deshmukh Krishi Vidyapeeth in Maharashtra's Akola. Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari awarded the degree to the Gadkari. Former Vice Chancellor Dr Motilal Madan, deans of faculty, professors, teachers and graduating students were present on the occasion.

384.title: Global economic outlook has darkened, can't rule out recession: IMF
384.article_body: IMF MD Kristalina Georgieva has said the outlook for the global economy has "darkened significantly" since April and the possibility of a global recession next year can't be ruled out. "We're in very choppy waters," she added, citing a more universal spread of inflation and increased interest rate hikes. IMF would soon further downgrade its 2022 growth forecast, she added.

385.title: Mumbai beaches to open only from 6-10 am during red, orange alerts for rainfall
385.article_body: Beaches in Mumbai will open for the general public only from 6 am to 10 am during the period of red and orange alerts issued by IMD, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said. The decision has been taken in view of drowning incidents on various beaches in the city this year. People should be informed about it immediately, BMC added.

386.title: Dalai Lama is India's guest: MEA on reaction to PM's b'day greeting
386.article_body: After China criticised PM Narendra Modi for greeting Dalai Lama on his 87th birthday on Wednesday, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Thursday said that India treats the Tibetan spiritual leader as an honoured guest. The Chinese Foreign Ministry had said that India should fully recognise the separatist nature of Dalai Lama and stop interfering in China's internal affairs.

387.title: Rajnath Singh to brief parliamentary panel on Agnipath scheme on July 11
387.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will brief the members of the Parliamentary Consultative Committee on Defence on various aspects of the Agnipath scheme on July 11. The committee comprises MPs from ruling as well as opposition parties. The Defence Secretary, three Service Chiefs and other senior officials of the Defence Ministry are likely to be present in the meeting.

388.title: Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal's romance began on 'Koffee With...': Karan
388.article_body: Karan Johar revealed it was on his show 'Koffee With Karan', where Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif's romance began. In an interview with a news portal, Karan revealed that he "loved" that the "VicKat" romance started on his couch. "I love...Vicky, Katrina's romance. I love...it came out of nowhere, it was beautiful and it started on this couch," Karan said.

389.title: What is the 'Pennywise' malware that uses YouTube videos to steal crypto?
389.article_body: Cyber intelligence company Cyble has warned of an "emerging threat" from a crypto-stealing malware called 'Pennywise' which may potentially spread through YouTube. Fraudsters are reportedly marketing 'Pennywise' as a free Bitcoin mining software and it can target 30 crypto wallets and browser extensions. More than 80 YouTube videos have been found that may expose users to potential hacks.

390.title: Afghan soil won't be used for attacks on other countries: Taliban
390.article_body: Taliban leader Hibatullah Akhundzada said on Wednesday that no country will be allowed to use Afghan soil to target other countries. Akhundzada also added that other nations should refrain from meddling in Afghanistan's internal affairs. "We want...strong diplomatic, economic and political relations with the whole world, including the US, within the framework of mutual...commitment," he added.

391.title: TMC delegation meets Governor over Dilip Ghosh's remarks against Mamata
391.article_body: An eight-member delegation of TMC, including party's leader Kunal Ghosh, met Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Thursday, seeking action against BJP leader Dilip Ghosh for his alleged derogatory comments against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. Governor Dhankhar has assured the TMC delegation that he will look into the matter. Ghosh had allegedly made some remarks about Banerjee's family during an event.

392.title: 16-yr-old accused of killing 17-yr-old TN boy to be tried as adult
392.article_body: A 16-year-old boy, accused of killing a 17-year-old schoolmate in Tamil Nadu, will be tried as an adult after his case was transferred to regular criminal court. Selva Surya died on April 30 after three students of a government school in Tirunelveli district attacked him with a stone. Of the three accused, only one will be tried as an adult.

393.title: 9 minor boys escape from observation home in Chhattisgarh
393.article_body: Nine inmates of an observation home for minor boys, one of whom was facing murder charge, in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada escaped on Thursday, officials said. "All nine inmates tied the caretaker, a home guard jawan and another officer with ropes," an official said. In all, 19 minor inmates accused of various crimes were lodged at the remand home, the official added.

394.title: S Korean group floats balloons toward N Korea with COVID relief items
394.article_body: A South Korean group said that it launched 20 balloons carrying COVID-19 relief items toward North Korea on Wednesday. The balloons carried 20,000 masks and tens of thousands of vitamin C and fever-reducing tablets to the isolated country amid a COVID-19 outbreak there. This comes after North Korea suggested that the outbreak began due to balloons flown from South Korea.

395.title: Rajnath Singh calls up Tejashwi to enquire about Lalu Yadav's health
395.article_body: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday spoke to Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav and enquired about health of RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who is admitted at AIIMS in Delhi. "Praying for his speedy recovery," Rajnath Singh tweeted. Lalu Prasad Yadav was airlifted from Patna after he suffered a fracture due to a fall.

396.title: Doing my best to help underpopulation crisis: Musk after reports of welcoming twins
396.article_body: After reports claimed that Elon Musk welcomed twins with Neuralink top executive Shivon Zilis in November 2021, the Tesla CEO tweeted, "Doing my best to help the underpopulation crisis." "A collapsing birth rate is the biggest danger civilization faces by far," he added. Musk shares two children with singer Grimes and other five kids with his ex-wife Justine Wilson.

397.title: Precautions taken: Bommai after IMD predicts heavy rains in K'taka
397.article_body: After IMD predicted heavy rains in parts of Karnataka, CM Basavaraj Bommai said all necessary precautions have been taken after speaking to district deputy commissioners. "As per IMD, heavy rain is predicted in Kodagu, Dakshina Kannada, Udupi and Uttara Kannada," he said, adding teams are prepared with equipment. Three people died after a landslide in Dakshina Kannada district on Wednesday.

398.title: Bhadohi MP Ramesh Chand Bind gets threat call, FIR registered
398.article_body: Police on Thursday said that BJP MP from Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi, Ramesh Chand Bind, received an extortion call from an unidentified person who demanded ₹10 lakh from him. As per the complaint, the caller threatened to kill the MP and his family members if he failed to pay. An FIR has been lodged against the unidentified person, police said.

399.title: People think my decision to divorce Rajeev is wrong, it's for my daughter: Charu
399.article_body: Charu Asopa talked about her divorce from Rajeev Sen in her vlog and said people think her decision to divorce Rajeev is wrong, but she is taking the step after a lot of thinking. "I'm not taking the decision in a hurry or emotionally," she added. "I'm taking it consciously. It's not for me, it's for Ziana (daughter)," Charu said.

400.title: Russian forces taking operational pause in Ukraine: Foreign analysts
400.article_body: Russian forces may be taking an operational pause in Ukraine as part of efforts to reassemble its forces for a renewed assault, foreign analysts said. However, shelling by Russian forces in eastern Ukraine continued, according to Ukrainian officials. On Sunday, Russia said that it had taken control of Ukraine's Luhansk region after the fall of Lysychansk city.

401.title: India-focused PE, VC funds raised $14.1 bn in 2022: Report
401.article_body: In the first half of 2022, various India-focused private equity and venture capital funds have already raised $14.1 billion, as per a report by the Silicon Valley Bank. In the entirety of 2021, $4.2 billion was raised. As per the report, 48 funds have been launched in India taking the count from 28 last year to 76 now.
